intro: Ichnanthus almadensis var. subovatus, commonly known as the narrow-leafed ichnanthus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Iridaceae, which includes irises and related species. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and clusters of small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in spring. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in horticultural and ecological studies. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
